results.title: Stand by me
results.creator_credit: Rob Reiner, Raynold Gideon, Bruce A. Evans, Andrew Scheinman, ACT III Communications and Columbia Pictures
results.brief_description: In the summer of 1956, four youths set out on a two-day trek through the woods surrounding their home-town of Castle Rock, Oregon, to find the undiscovered body of a dead teenager reported missing for several days. Their adventure is filled with humour and suspense as they learn about friendship and growing up. Starring River Phoenix, Wil Wheaton, Corey Feldman, Kiefer Sutherland, John Cusack and Richard Dreyfuss.

results.title: Stand and deliver
results.creator_credit: Ramon Menendez, Tom Musca and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: Edward James Olmos gives a widely-acclaimed performance as Jaime Escalante, a dedicated Maths teacher at a Los Angeles high school where most of the inner-city students are underachievers and come from poor Latin American families. Escalante refuses to see them as losers and cajoles, pushes and inspires his class to become Maths wizards and to pass a national exam which no student of the school has ever passed before. With Lou Diamond Phillips and Andy Garcia.

results.title: Stan King: book binder
results.creator_credit: Terry McMahon, Nina Syme and Victorian Film Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Craft as a Livelihood”.
Stan King has been a bookbinder for forty-four years. Despite the mechanisation that has taken place, Stan believes that bookbinding is not finished as a craft and while there is a need for high quality books, there will be skilled craftsmen who will be able to produce them.

results.title: Stan and George's new life
results.creator_credit: Brian McKenzie, Margot McDonald and Lea Films
results.brief_description: On turning forty years old, Stan (Paul Chubb) decides to leave his job in his father’s barber shop and start a new life. He finds work in the Public Service, working in the Department of Meteorology. There he meets George (Julie Forsyte), a young country girl who is hoping to find happiness in the big city. They fall in love but Stan’s obsession with the weather, an obsession inherited from his father, threatens their secure future. Stan’s expertise with predicting the weather is too threatening for a Government Department run on a tradition of failure. Funny, compassionate and beautifully shot by cinematographer Ray Argall, “Stan and George’s New Life” continues McKenzie’s exploration of an intimate Australian cinema that faithfully captures the textures of Melbourne’s working-class life. Some of the funniest moments come from observing the daily run-ins and relationships of office life - even the tea-break requires a certain etiquette!
results.creator_credit_for_label: Brian McKenzie, Margot McDonald and Lea Films

results.title: Stan
results.brief_description:
A short created by a student for the 2004 ACMI Diegesis secondary school media festival.
A bizarre and comical look at a machine which processes different types of people and converts into the same looking character. This animted short depicts the way society homogenises the way people are meant to be and disregards anyone who stands outside of the accepted norm.

results.title: Stan
results.brief_description: This 3D computer animated tragedy tells the story in verse of a mad scientist who creates a human boy. A rework of the classic Frankenstein story, this black fairytale adds a new element to the tale.

results.title: Stamps: a nation's calling card
results.creator_credit: Donald Connolly, United States Postal Service, Papalios Productions and Charlie
results.brief_description: Since 1847, when stamps in the USA were first used, they have developed into a gallery of events and people important to the country, they have also become a textbook of changing styles of art. The film demonstrates how stamps are produced and claims that annually 28 billion stamps are sold in the USA both for postage and to collectors.

results.title: Stampede
results.creator_credit: Claude Fournier, Jacques Bobet and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Stampede Week in Calgary, with special focus on the main performers of the show, the cowboys and the horses. You see the herds come thundering in, and get to know one cowboy very well as he waits for his ride, He moves from rodeo to rodeo, always trying for the jackpot on the back of a bucking bronco.

results.title: Stamp of approval
results.creator_credit: Raymond Garceau, Michael Spencer and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A long history of research and development means that agricultural produce has attained a high standard. The government program of testing and surveillance maintains quality control, and gives the world market confidence in Canadian products.
